text: :Not to be confused with Kattowitzer Volkswille, which ran from 1916-c1935 in Upper Silesia. Volkswille (People's Will) was a communist newspaper published in Potsdam, East Germany, from 1945 to 1946. The frequency of publishing shifted from daily, weekly and triweekly. It merged with Märker, forming the newspaper Märkische Volksstimme.Icon ==References== Category:German-language newspapers Category:Newspapers published in Germany Category:Communist newspapers Category:Communist Party of Germany Category:Mass media in Potsdam
title: Volkswille
